title: Thin film - 5e14 Hz light and air-film-glass

content.question: Light is normally incident on a piece of glass that is coated with a thin layer of film, as shown in the figure. The film and the glass have indexes of refraction <math alttext="n sub film, end sub, equals 1.20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>n</mi><mtext>film</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>1.20</mn></math> and <math alttext="n sub glass, end sub, equals 1.50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>n</mi><mtext>glass</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>1.50</mn></math>, respectively, and the light has a frequency of <math alttext="5.00 times 10 to the fourteenth power hertz" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.00</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>14</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Hz</mtext></math>. What is the minimum nonzero thickness of film that would result in the most intense reflection of light from the film and glass?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
